summary: The Comptroller General testified before Congress about the federal government's unsustainable long-term fiscal outlook—the growing imbalance between revenues (money collected) and spending (driven by health care, Social Security, and net interest on the debt). A plan is needed to put the nation on a sustainable long-term fiscal path. But in the near-term, Congress and executive branch agencies have opportunities to improve the government's fiscal condition...
title: The Nation's Fiscal Health: Action is Needed to Address the Federal Government's Fiscal Future
